bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: The plee-the-bear package in Fedora 24 is entirely non-functional because it fails to find a shared library (libbear_generic_items.so) due to a stray buildroot reference.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): plee-the-bear-0.7.0-5.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Run plee-the-bear.
Actual results: If you run it from the menu, nothing happens. Running it from a terminal emulator (Konsole in my case) reveals the reason: Exception: /builddir/build/BUILD/plee-the-bear-0.7.0-light/plee-the-bear/../bear/bear-engine/bin/libbear_generic_items.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
Expected results: The game starts.
plee-the-bear-0.7.0-7.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-793d58917d
plee-the-bear-0.7.0-7.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-90f8cbc2e2

plee-the-bear-0.7.0-7.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-793d58917d
